snippet: Debates have broken out over the accuracy of the online campaign and the intentions of the charity that prepared it.
abstract: Invisible Children's YouTube video Kony 2012 about Ugandan warlord Joseph Kony and his Lord's Resistance Army spurs debate; critics say movie misleads viewers by suggesting that the LRA is still present in Uganda and that the rebel group counts up to 30,000 child soldiers in its ranks.
lead_paragraph: Debates have broken out over the accuracy of the online campaign and the intentions of the charity that prepared it.

headline.seo: Few in Uganda Can See Video of Rebel Leader, Kony
headline.main: In Uganda, Few Can See Kony Video
headline.print_headline: In Uganda, Few Can See Kony Video
